file_content.text: I hope you're not still carrying my chemicals, because that would mean you're dead.
Don't--don't stand there. That spot is reserved exclusively for my gundark friends. You're clearly not a gundark. Your ears are too small.
Listen, do you smell that? There's a pot of Alderaanian stew bubbling. But how could I smell it all the way on Ord Mantell?
Viidu sent me to pick up a canister of chemicals from you.
You must be Trymbo.
What's a "Viidu"? Some kind of musical instrument? Is that what keeps playing that awful tune I can't get out of my head?
Because you're nuts?
Insane? What? How--how dare you--oh, now I'm smelling Bakuran cloudberries. By the stars, those--those would taste awful in an Alderaanian stew.
That's quite a stench you've got going, crazy old man.
All I can smell is you.
Stench? Impossible. I bathe eight times a day. It's the only way to keep that invisible Kowakian monkey-lizard from drinking all my blood.
Hmm... I do recall a man saying to expect a stranger coming for my chemicals. You seem pretty strange. Was he talking about you?
You've inhaled a lot of chemicals, haven't you?
I'm the strange one?
Did my wife tell you that? She's been dead twenty years now. Don't listen to her.
Why else would I be here?
Have you been diagnosed with a terminal illness? Are you trying to avoid marrying someone? There are better ways to kill yourself, you know.
Just give me your chemicals before I shoot you.
I don't have time for this.
I'd be careful about firing a blaster in here. You'll wake the rancor, and he's very disagreeable when he hasn't had enough sleep.
People haven't had much luck getting my chemicals. Know why? Those Ugnaught assassins in the woods attack everyone who visits me.
Ugnaught assassins? Don't you mean separatists?
You're very confused, pal.
Who do you think really controls the separatists? Those crafty little swine, that's who. But we can beat them.
Just hand that thing over, Captain Crazy.
Who cares, nutjob?
How dare you--I'm a colonel.
I'll just kill everyone who tries to stop me.
I'm good in a fight.
That hasn't worked out well for the others who took on the Ugnaught assassins, but maybe you'll be the lucky one.
What you really need is a precision teleporter, but a former assistant crashed my prototype into the sun.
Good luck, my friend. If you should explode, please feel free to come back and tell me all about it. Everyone else has.
I saw a herd of rancors advising the village mayor in the town square yesterday. They're very political beasts, those rancors.
Good luck delivering my canister of chemicals. Your only hope to avoid the Ugnaught assassins is that stealth field generator.
Take a chemical canister from the storage unit and try not to explode. Good luck!
Test out the stealth field generator, then take a chemical canister from my storage unit and run for your life.
When danger calls, I prefer to saunter.
Running isn't my style.
You've been great, Trymbo.
I can't take anymore.
When you activate the stealth field generator, you'll have to move slowly to avoid enemy detection. That's its only limitation.
What happens if I attack while I'm in a stealth field?
Can I fight?
Any sort of violent movement disrupts the stealth field. So no fighting, running or improvisational dancing unless you really mean it.
I'll take it.
Enough babbling.
It's important to understand how to use the device. There's nothing worse than not being invisible when Ugnaught assassins are around.
All right, here you go. Wait, those are my old suspenders. Don't worry, I know that stealth field generator is around here somewhere....
One last thing: Don't sneak all the way to Fort Garnik. My formula turns explosive after a short time. Deliver it before that happens.
Good to know.
That's the spirit. Look on the bright side--if you fail, you probably won't even realize it.
The Ugnaught assassins slow people down, and that makes my chemical canisters explode. Can you be invisible so the assassins won't see you?
No one will see me. I'll blend in with the shadows.
Don't worry, I'm stealthy.
No good. There aren't nearly enough shadows, and you can't trust them anyway. They move when you're not looking. You need technological assistance.
How much time do I have until the canister explodes?
How long is that?
That's a good question. I really ought to time it one of these days.
No need to avoid them.
No, you must never trust them. They'll ply you with cheap Mandalorian wine and whisper sweet nothings while they stab you in the back.
I have a stealth field generator that works like a charm. You just turn it on and "poof"! You're invisible. But there's a catch....
You want credits for this thing, right?
It's expensive.
Goodness, no! The belt is a gift, your highness. Please give the people of Alderaan my best when you get home.
I'm not following any of this.
The stealth field generator bends light around its wearer so he can't be seen. Handy for escaping boring conversations, but there are limits.
